subject: Education
title: Retrieval Practice: Testing as Learning
description: A 60-second lesson on Retrieval Practice: Testing as Learning.

hook.text: Students who test themselves learn 50% more than students who re-read the same material. Testing isn't just assessment

buildup.text: Retrieval practice means pulling information from memory rather than passively reviewing it. The effort of recall

discovery.text: Every time you successfully retrieve a memory, the neural pathway strengthens. Re-reading does not create this effect.

twist.text: Students hate testing and love re-reading. But feeling fluent while re-reading is an illusion. Testing feels harder

climax.text: The most effective study technique feels the worst. Struggle and effort create learning; comfort and ease create

punchline.text: If studying feels easy, you're probably not learning. Struggle is the signal.

quiz.question: Why is retrieval practice more effective than re-reading?
options: The effort of recalling information strengthens memory pathways
